remarks.format:
## Remarks Under normal circumstances, <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer> ignores errors and continues localizing the source BAML input. As a result, the output BAML is partially localized. By listening for errors this event can be used to stop the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer> and stop processing a source BAML file.
The most common user case where <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer.ErrorNotify> might be raised is as a result of an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizer.UpdateBaml%2A> call where the update contained errors. For example, the event is raised if an attempted update set a duplicate key, or if the original and update did not have UID values that align.
